Question
========

29% of Internet users sometimes download movies, 67% of downloaders don't care if they are copyrighted. If we want to know the probability that we randomly choose someone who downloads movies when he doesn't don't care if they are copyrighted, which rule can you use to calculate this probability?

Answerlist
----------

* General addition rule
* Complement rule
* Addition rule
* Product rule

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* General addition rule: Incorrect
* Complement rule: Incorrect
* Addition rule: Incorrect
* Product rule: Correct
